agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - HOWARD COUNTY
service_name: SENIOR FARMERS MARKET NUTRITION PROGRAM - HOWARD COUNTY
service_description: Offers Farmers Market electronic dollars to eligible seniors at no cost to use at participating farmers markets for fresh fruits and vegetables. Each participant receives $50 in electronic funds that must be used within 30 days of distribution. There are limited slots available with a waitlist following distribution, awaiting funds becoming available after 30 days due to non-use.
site_details: Participants must complete a new application each fiscal year. -- Call to schedule an appointment or for available dates and times; (A list of participating markets is available on the market app, electronically only.) -- Participant may designate a proxy to apply for certification and purchase of produce.
site_eligibility: Living in the county where eligibility is being determined -- Age 60 or older -OR- Age 55 or older, person with disabilities that is living in housing for elderly and participating in a congregate nutrition service -- Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines, utilizing a confirmed agency service

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides  pregnancy testing and ultrasound as well as pregnancy, adoption, and parenting education. We offer abortion pill reversal. We offer post abortion recovery and grief support from the loss of a baby.
site_name: LIVING ALTERNATIVES PREGNANCY RESOURCE CENTER - KOKOMO
service_description: Provides diapers, infant formula, baby food, baby clothing, and maternity clothing for pregnant women, new mothers, and new fathers in need. Supplies are available once or twice on an emergency basis; after that, clients are required to attend parenting classes to be eligible for additional assistance.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website to request an appointment; walk-ins are also accepted. -- (After the first or second visit, clients are required to attend parenting classes before being eligible for additional supplies.)
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, new mothers, or new fathers with small children, age 2 or younger

agency_name: INDIANA HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY - BALANCE OF STATE CONTINUUM OF CARE
agency_desc: This is not a true agency record, but rather a collection of lead regional agencies providing coordinated entry services to individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
site_name: REGION 5 - LEAD AGENCY - UNITED WAY OF HOWARD AND TIPTON COUNTIES
service_name: COORDINATED ENTRY - UNITED WAY OF HOWARD AND TIPTON COUNTIES
service_description: Leads housing intake, assessment, referrals, and placement coordination for individuals and families experiencing homelessness.
nameLevel3: At Risk/Homeless Housing Related Assistance Programs
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an assessment appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Currently and chronically homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions)

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Russiaville -- Limit two (2) visits per month

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Offers nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in
site_eligibility: Living within boundaries: N- Markland St.; S- State Rd 26.; W-Park Rd; E-Goyer St. -- Not received assistance from this pantry within the past 30 days

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing numerous community outreach programs to eligible families in Howard County.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food (including meat and frozen items), baby formula, and personal grooming supplies, to those in need.
site_details: Walk in during schedule time.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs for the city of Kokomo.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in the city of Kokomo in Howard County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently CLOSED, but pre-applications are being taken. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: The Housing Choice Voucher wait list for Kokomo city is currently closed. No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: Provides pregnancy counseling and support from a pro-life perspective, and offers referrals to prenatal care, adoption resources, and other abortion alternatives.
service_description: Provides pregnancy counseling and support from a pro-life perspective, and offers referrals to prenatal care, adoption resources, and other abortion alternatives. Free, confidential pregnancy test and pregnancy verification are also available for those in need.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon 10am-5pm; Tues and Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 3-7pm
Mon 10am-5pm; Tues and Wed noon-5pm; Thurs 3-7pm
site_eligibility: Women in need of pregnancy test -- Pregnant women

agency_name: UNITED WAY OF HOWARD AND TIPTON COUNTIES
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
site_name: UNITED WAY OF HOWARD AND TIPTON COUNTIES
service_description: Screens individuals in need, in Howard County, to determine eligibility for various programs that offer limited financial assistance. Funds may help with mortgage, rent, and utilities, including deposits; covering medical and dental copays; discounting prescription costs; obtaining birth certificates and identification cards; work transportation for new hires or medical transportation costs; and covering fees or expenses for adult education. Funds are limited and the amounts pledged vary by program.
site_details: Call to schedule a screening appointment. Appointments should be same-day; best to call by 8:30am.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Appointments: Mon, Tues, Thurs 12:30pm-4:00pm; Wed 8:00am-11:30am and 12:30pm-4:00pm

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides referrals to physicians and services within the Community Howard Regional Health. An online tool for finding doctors by location, specialty, type of insurance accepted, language spoken, and gender is also available.
site_details: Call or visit the website for assistance.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: COMMUNITY HOWARD REGIONAL BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES
service_description: Offers treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, medication management, an intensive outpatient program (IOP), partial hospitalization, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients. Level of care is determined by assessment.

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Howard County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Howard County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing support and outreach for labor unions. This agency also offers assistance to the community at-large, including wheelchair ramp consultation and school supplies.
service_description: Coordinates union-based programs in Howard and Tipton County. Provides consultation and education services to unions, work sites, and union members. Offers assistance to employers and workers during employment transitions (such as layoffs and closures). Facilitates union-led community outreach programs.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment; office is currently closed to walk-ins.
site_eligibility: Unions, work sites, or union members in Howard or Tipton County

service_description: Offers gently used clothing, small household goods, and furniture at discounted prices. Appliances may available depending on donations.

service_description: Provides temporary emergency shelter for women, with or without children, who are experiencing homelessness.
site_details: Call to check on shelter availability; an assessment will be conducted if space is available.
site_eligibility: Adult women (age 18 or older) with or without children -- Experiencing homelessness -- Able to obtain police clearance

service_description: Provides temporary emergency shelter for women without children, who are experiencing homelessness.
site_details: Call to check on shelter availability; an assessment will be conducted if space is available.
site_eligibility: Adult women (age 18 or older) without children -- Experiencing homelessness -- Able to obtain police clearance

agency_desc: An extension of the city of Kokomo offering senior recreation and socialization activities.
service_description: Offers recreational and social activities for Kokomo-area seniors. Fitness classes, dancing, and card games are regularly offered. Other events and programs may include travel opportunities, outreach projects, and health screenings.
site_details: Call for information or walk in to fill out an application to become a member.
site_eligibility: Age 50 or older

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry, clothing and household goods pantry.
service_description: Provides food to people in need. Agency referrals are required to access the pantry. Limited service area.
site_details: Contact one of the following agencies to obtain a paper referral (with a letterhead.) -- Call to schedule an appointment for the pantry. -- Division of Family Resources (114 West Jackson Street Kokomo, IN 46901) -- Saint Vincent De Paul -- (208 South Union Street Kokomo, IN 46901) -- United Way (210 West Walnut Street Kokomo, IN 46901)
site_eligibility: With a referral from one of the following local agencies: Division of Family Services, Saint Vincent De Paul, or United Way of Howard County -- Received assistance from an area food pantry within the past 30 days

agency_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF HOWARD COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides meals to home-bound persons living in the city of Kokomo who cannot adequately prepare their own meals because of illness, age, or disability.
site_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF HOWARD COUNTY
service_description: Delivers hot, afternoon meals each weekday to homebound persons. A physician's diet prescription is required. Accommodations can be made for clients with diabetes or other conditions requiring special diets. Limited service area. This agency also accepts volunteers to help with meal delivery.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within 5 miles of the city of Kokomo  -- With a diet prescription from a physician

agency_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit that provides support and services to all citizens with mental health and addiction issues through education and advocacy.
site_name: MENTAL HEALTH AMERICA OF NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA
service_description: Offers mental health information, referrals, and educational resources. Advocates on behalf of adults and children with mental and emotional disorders and their families. Promotes increased public awareness on mental health issues and lobbies for public and private policies that protect the rights and well-being of persons with mental illness.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm -- Crisis center: Daily 24 hours
Office: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm -- Crisis center: Daily 24 hours

service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Open service area.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and personal hygiene items to people in need. Open service area.

site_schedule: Monthly 2nd Tues 1pm-3pm and 4th Tues 9:30am-noon -- 3rd Tues the month of Dec
site_eligibility: Limit visit to once a month

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Howard County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Howard County. A seven-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Howard County

agency_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - SAGAMORE COUNCIL
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization with a strong focus on the outdoors and survival skills that aims to support young people in their physical, mental, and spiritual development so that they may play constructive roles in society.
site_name: BOY SCOUTS OF AMERICA - SAGAMORE COUNCIL
service_description: Offers an adventure-themed leadership program for young men and women. This program is available at various sites throughout the region.
site_details: Call for information about joining the nearest Venturing program.
site_eligibility: Age 14-20 -- Must have completed 8th grade

agency_desc: A non-profit organization providing transportation, personal shopping, and other nonmedical assistance for seniors.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area seniors, within set boundaries.
site_details: Call to reserve a ride at least one week in advance.
site_eligibility: Age 65 or older

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Kokomo.
service_description: Advocates against unlawful and discriminatory practices related to housing, finance, and employment in the city of Kokomo in Howard County. Processes complaints and makes recommendations to governmental, public, and private agencies.
site_details: Call, visit website for information or to obtain a complaint form.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Kokomo

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Kokomo.
site_name: CITY OF KOKOMO - PUBLIC MAINTENANCE AND REFUSE
service_description: Provides snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, trash pick-up, limb and tree pick-up, and curbside recycling in the city of Kokomo in Howard County.
site_details: Call or email for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Kokomo

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Kokomo.
service_description: Provides code inspection and enforcement; responds to reports of abandoned vehicles and overgrown weeds on private property; handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals for the city of Kokomo in Howard County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Kokomo city limits

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Kokomo.
service_description: Issues permits for construction and remodeling projects in the city of Kokomo.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Kokomo city limits

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Kokomo.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Kokomo in Howard County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support, education, and access to healthcare services for the residents of Howard County.
service_description: Offers guidance to eligible Howard County persons managing diabetes. Diet, exercise, medication maintenance, and other lifestyle information is provided. Referrals to local support groups and low-cost medical or eye care are also available. An intake appointment is required to determine eligibility before any services may be received.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to request an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Howard County -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level -- With no health insurance of any kind (including HIP, VA, Medicaid, or Medicare) -- Diagnosed with diabetes

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering a variety of support and housing services to those in need within Howard County and surrounding areas.
service_description: Provides transportation services to medical, legal, and Social Security appointments outside of Kokomo city limits. A client application must be completed before services can be offered. Availability may be limited, and reservations are required.
site_details: Non-clients: Call for more information or to request an application. -- Existing clients: Call to request transportation at least 72 hours in advance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri 8am-4:30pm; Wed 8am-noon -- Transportation: Vary by client need and driver availability

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a recreation center to youth, including a reading program.
service_description: Provides recreational programs and activities for people of all ages living in Howard County. Members pay an annual fee for open access to the fitness center and most other services; special programs, including boxing and youth basketball, are offered for an additional fee.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and faith-based counseling to those in the Howard County area.
site_name: HOPE BIBLICAL COUNSELING CENTER - BIBLE BAPTIST CHURCH
service_description: Offers free, faith-based counseling to individuals, couples, and families in need. Support is available for common mental health issues, addictions, grief, and anger management.

agency_desc: A nonprofit animal shelter that contracts with the city of Kokomo and the surrounding Howard County area to provide animal control services.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include dry and wet pet food, small animal beds, blankets, office supplies, cleaning towels and rags. Volunteers assist with shelter duties, including kennel maintenance, and animal socialization.
site_details: Call or visit the website make donation arrangements or to inquire about volunteering.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Thurs, and Fri noon-5pm; Wed noon-6pm; Sat 10am-5pm

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services, and specialized information and referral for family members, caregivers, and those affected by autism spectrum disorders.
service_description: Provides information and referrals to families and persons inquiring about autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This agency also provides a supportive community for individuals of all ages affected by ASD.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_name: KOKOMO AND HOWARD COUNTY GOVERNMENTAL COORDINATING COUNCIL
agency_desc: A government agency that plans and administers transportation systems for the Kokomo metropolitan area.
site_name: KOKOMO AND HOWARD COUNTY GOVERNMENTAL COORDINATING COUNCIL
service_description: Offers free public bus transportation along set routes within the city of Kokomo.
site_details: Rides: walk on at any stop. -- For route and schedule information, Call or visit the website.

service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
site_name: KOKOMO SCHOOL CORPORATION HEAD START PROGRAM
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for children from low-income families. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at two locations. Transportation is provided within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information and locations. -- Walk in to either location or visit the website to complete an application.
site_eligibility: Living in Howard, Miami, or Tipton County -- Ages 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- Children who are in low-income households based on federal poverty levels

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that aims to promote and strengthen literacy skills among people age 16 and older.
service_description: Provides one-on-one tutoring, small group exercises, and computer-assisted instruction. Assistance is available for a variety of proficiency levels and subjects, including adult basic education (ABE), English as a second language (ESL), citizenship, and high school equivalency test preparation. Students are matched with trained volunteers. Volunteers are accepted at all proficiency levels.
site_details: Call or walk in to request an assessment or inquire about volunteering.
site_schedule: Office hours: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Tutoring sessions: Tues and Wed 8am-3pm
Office hours: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Tutoring sessions: Tues and Wed 8am-3pm

agency_desc: A government organization that accepts for disposal yard waste and household consumer products that are generally considered hazardous or environmentally unsafe to dispose of improperly.
service_description: Provides and maintains five Howard County drop-off centers for recycling paper, cardboard, glass jars/bottles, metal cans/bottles, and plastics (1-7). Trash and hazardous materials are not accepted at these centers.
site_details: Call for a complete list of local drop-off centers or to report full bins.

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF THE KOKOMO COMMUNITY
agency_desc: A nonprofit christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Howard County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF THE KOKOMO COMMUNITY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan.
site_details: Call to register for the next information meeting; attendance is required to receive an application.
site_eligibility: Household income between 30%-50% of area median (Call or see website for current amounts) -- Able to make payments (steady employment or equivalent income) -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides employment training and support services for migrant and seasonal farm workers.
service_name: NATIONAL FARMWORKER JOBS PROGRAM - CENTRAL REGION
service_description: Provides employment and training services and educational funding for qualified migrant, seasonal farm workers and agricultural workers. A wide variety of support services are available to participants in the program.
site_details: Call for information and assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Bartholomew, Brown, Clark, Dearborn, Decatur, Fayette, Floyd, Franklin, Harrison, Jackson, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, Rush, Scott, Switzerland, Union, and Washington County -- Migrant and seasonal farm workers and agricultural workers -- Having a low income determination or disability -- Authorized to work in the United States, including all US territories

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials and electronic resources to patrons of all ages.

service_description: Facilitates and trains volunteers to assist with library tasks and special programming.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri and Sat 9am-5:30pm; Sun 2pm-5:30pm -- Volunteer hours vary by position.
Mon-Thurs 9am-8pm; Fri and Sat 9am-5:30pm; Sun 2pm-5:30pm -- Volunteer hours vary by position.

service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Howard County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials and electronic resources to patrons of all ages.
site_name: KOKOMO-HOWARD COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - RUSSIAVILLE BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access, as well as a Nature Explore Classroom.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides comprehensive health, social services and education programming to pregnant women, infants, children and their families.
service_description: Offers free developmental screenings by licensed therapists and teachers for children up to age five. Screenings measure motor skills, cognitive skills, language skills, social skills, and vision. This service is offered on set dates each year.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for the next screening date.
site_eligibility: Children, age 5 or younger

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Greentown in Howard County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services, Provides residential trash pickup.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Greentown in Howard County

agency_name: THE VERY EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION CENTER
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that promotes parents as their child's first teachers and strives to help parents shape their child's academic learning in early stages of their life.
service_description: Offers a free, 8-week parenting class each Spring and Fall. Provides a weekly speaker on topics such as developmental milestone, car seat and home safety, temper tantrums, Kindergarten readiness, and more.
site_details: Calling to register is preferred; walk-ins are welcome at any point in the eight week period.
site_eligibility: Parents, expectant parents, grandparents, foster parents, and caregivers

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Howard County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Howard County dispatch at (765) 457-1105.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Howard County)

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: For claims, call to schedule an appointment. For all other services, call or walk in.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Howard County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Child Support Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-11:30am, 1pm-4pm Fri 8am-11:30am -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours;   live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Child Support Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-11:30am, 1pm-4pm Fri 8am-11:30am -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours;   live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Howard County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Howard County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register.
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: HOWARD COUNTY CIRCUIT AND SUPERIOR COURT
service_description: Provides juvenile probation services for the Howard County Circuit Court, including supervising offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the probation office; call for details.
site_eligibility: Juvenile offenders assigned to probation by the Howard County Circuit Court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Howard County, Superior Court 3 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Howard County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Howard County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Howard County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides adult probation services for the Howard County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the probation office; call for details.
site_eligibility: Adult offenders assigned to probation by the Howard County Circuit or Superior Court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees court cases involving Howard County minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses. A public defender may be requested for defendants who cannot a afford a private attorney.
site_details: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court
site_eligibility: Age 17 or under

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, and swimming lessons/water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the health and wellness center, fitness classes, and pool and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for programs. Preschool, teen clubs, day camps, and school-age child care are also available for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: A farmers market program that officers locally grown foods and fresh produce in the city of Kokomo in Howard County.
service_description: Sells local produce, fresh meats, baked goods, and handcrafted items to the community. Select vendors at this market accept Senior and WIC Farmers Market Nutrition Program checks and participate in the SNAP dollar matching program for qualifying food items.
taxonomy_name: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
nameLevel4: Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
Farmers Markets Accepting Nutrition Program Vouchers
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Howard County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.
site_details: Call or walk in.
site_eligibility: Victims of major crimes in Howard County

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Kokomo in Howard County.
service_description: Provides temporary shelter for households residing in mobile homes to seek safety during tornado storm weather. Limited space; limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Howard County -- Residing in a mobile home

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Offers gently used clothing to people in need. Infant through adult sizes are generally available. Selection varies depending on donations.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received clothing from this church within the current month

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a private, full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT KOKOMO - CLINIC OF HOPE
service_name: CASE MANAGEMENT - RURAL AND URBAN ACCESS TO HEALTH
service_description: Provides one-on-one assistance to help people in rural and under-served areas apply for health and human service benefits, find affordable health care, access prescription assistance programs, and connect with community resources. Care coordination and follow-up services are available. Health access workers can meet with clients at their homes or convenient community locations.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; leave a voicemail with contact information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: ST JOSEPH PHYSICAL AND SPORTS THERAPY
service_description: Provides monthly information and support to stroke survivors and their family members. Meetings are facilitated by certified speech-language pathologists. Offers separate groups for stroke survivors and caregivers.
site_details: Visit the website or call for meeting information.
site_eligibility: People recovering from a stroke and their caregivers

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a monthly support group for people dealing with grief.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Visit the website or call for meeting information.
site_eligibility: Anyone dealing with grief

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a monthly support group for those dealing with grief.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Visit the website or call for meeting information.
site_eligibility: Anyone dealing with grief

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT KOKOMO - KOKOMO PARKINSON'S GROUP
service_description: Offers a monthly support group for people with Parkinson's disease, their family members and caregivers.
site_details: Visit the website or call for meeting information.
site_eligibility: Persons with Parkinson's disease and their family members or caregivers

agency_desc: Offers self-help support groups, networking and information throughout the state in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences.
service_description: Offers support groups in which members help each other stay drug-free and share recovery experiences. This area has meetings in Cass, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and White County.
site_details: Call or visit website for meeting times and locations. -- Call and leave a message to receive a call-back from a recovering addict. -- All meetings are walk-in only.
site_schedule: Automated Information Line: Daily 24 Hours -- Meetings: Vary
site_eligibility: Closed Meetings: Addicts or those who think they may have a drug problem -- Open Meetings: Anyone wishing to experience narcotics anonymous fellowship

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAM
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Five), providing services to seniors in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_name: AREA FIVE CONGREGATE MEAL - KOKOMO SENIOR CENTER
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for area seniors. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance. A donation is requested.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES - SENIOR NUTRITION PROGRAM
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging (Area Five), providing services to seniors in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_name: AREA FIVE CONGREGATE MEAL - FRIENDSHIP HAVEN
service_description: Provides nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for area seniors. Reservations required at least 24 hours in advance. A donation is requested.
site_details: Call at least 24 hours in advance for reservations.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
site_name: THE VILLAGES - NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA - KOKOMO
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: Provides community health services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers a range of primary dental care services (including exams, cleanings, fillings, and extractions) to patients of all ages. Sliding-scale fees are available for the uninsured.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A collection of services offered by Howard County government offices.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in the County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Howard County

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - KOKOMO DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A funeral home offering a community support group.
site_name: SHIRLEY AND STOUT JEFFERSON STREET CHAPEL
service_description: Offers a support group to those experiencing grief as the result of any loss (including the loss of a loved one, employment, or housing). Support group is offered twice per year.
taxonomy_name: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
nameLevel5: General Bereavement and Grief Support Groups
site_details: Call for information and upcoming schedule.
site_eligibility: Experiencing grief following any kind of loss

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use issues and their families. Also includes intensive outpatient services and drug screenings.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-7pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Fri 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
service_description: Provides counseling to individuals, couples, and families struggling with depression, anxiety, stress, relationship problems, and other intellectual and mental health issues. Level of care is based on assessment. Sliding scale fees are available for income-eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Open
